Description: Three fragments (one formed of eleven joining pieces) of the neck, shoulder and one handle of a painted pottery Fikellura style amphora (Diagonally Decorated group) Neck, meander and square. Shoulder, tongues in compartments: dividing band of unusually long strokes. Belly, dot reticulation with rosettes of four dots as filling: crescents.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: BM GR 1888,0208.56.n is made of several fragments reconstructed together (some of them re-numbered 1924,1201.1056, 1924,1201.1069, 1924,1201.1071, 1924,1201.1091, 1924,1201.1093), including also 1888,0208.54.j (re-numbered 1924,1201.1072). One additional fragment (1888,0208.56.n = 1924,1201.1083 joined to 1888,0208.54.i = 1924,1201.1081) also joins but is currently not part of the reconstruction. A further fragment, 1888,0208.56.n (re-numbered as1924,1201.1073) may be possibly from the same pot). According to Cook and Weber, BM GR 1888,0208.54.g (re-numbered 1924,1201.1077) joins the same pot. A number '18' seems to be pencilled (faded) on 1888,0208.56.n / 1924,1201.1071, which would confirm the findspot number given on Petrie1888, pl. xxxii, 1.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 578, 4)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxii, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 214)
